laml_libs.Count_model.AlleleTable module¶

class laml_libs.Count_model.AlleleTable.AlleleTable(data_struct, alphabet, max_allele_per_cassette=None)[source]¶

Bases: object

A class to represent the allele table (i.e. the observed data which has associated count/intensity for every allele) .. attribute:: K

the number of cassettes

J¶

the number of sites per cassette

data_struct¶

a mapping: cell_name -> (cassette -> (cassette_state -> count)). The data type is “dictionary of lists of dictionaries”

alphabet¶

an instance of class Alphabet

NOTE: We will use “cassette_state” and “allele” interchangeably throughout

get(w, k)[source]¶
Get the UMI count of cell w at cassette k of all alleles

w: a cell name/label k: a cassette index

return: a dictionary cassette_state (i.e. allele) -> count

get_one_count(w, k, x)[source]¶
Get the UMI count of cell w at cassette k of allele x

w: a cell name/label k: a cassette index x: a state of the specified cassette; must be a tuple of length self.J

return: an integer

is_missing(w, k)[source]¶
Check if cassette k of cell w is missing (i.e. has no UMI count)

w: a cell name/label k: a cassette index

return: True/False
